column4: I realise this is slightly off topic but is a 5400rpm usb2 hard disk fast enough to play full def 1080p mp4 videos?
actionparsnip: thanks - wasnt sure if a 7200 would be needed. There isnt a particular screen - I just didnt know if it would be fast enough and hence the question
actionparsnip: you got any experience of samsung drives - I always buy western digital but the samsung is cheaper
actionparsnip: most probably wont be but as I was asking the question I picked that as probably most resource hungry
its fast enough in most cases (for AVC bitrates)
it should get about 160 Mbits/s, and avc video is usually no more than 25 Mbits/s
ok thanks - just the brand to choose now
i have bunch on wds, all still working
yes I love WD but tempted by cheaper samsung
id go with whatever has better replacement policy
always test them when brand new (copy few mp3s or whatever and check md5sums)
i had a noname drive that would copy like 4 of 5 files correcly, no system errors reported, but md5 was my return tool
anyone here in the uk and can recommend a good manufacturer of 2.5inch disk enclosures that are strong and built well
sorry all - I know off topic but we are all techies - wont ask again :)
